    “Color Correction Campus” slides on Sharpening


    The lecture about sharpening I did last October for the Color Correction Campus went apparently so well that I’ve decided to share the slides I’ve shown. Since I was just a support teacher I could afford to be totally unconventional, so I tried a daring approach to the subject. If you feel brave enough to download the italian slides I wrote by hand withÂ NoteshelfÂ on my iPad, you’ll possibly have some fun too – even though I’ve been told the better part was me wandering through the class saying crazy things about sharpening techniques in Photoshop, based on the evolution of perception in human beings!
